data.name: The Society of Essoteric Knowledge and Technology - SEKT

data.text: A member of a newly created secret society goes missing and is found in the clutches of an evil wizard where she is sacrificed to prolong the wizards life.
data.title: jsp.architecture.thumbnail.premise.title
data.subtitle: jsp.architecture.thumbnail.premise.description

data.text:
1. Myserteous professors begin a secret society framed as a study group dealing with Myth, Folklore and Religion.
  2. One of the top members goes missing.
  3. The new members begin to search for their missing friend.
  4. They discover a newly hired professor who may be a 200 plus year old wizard who has been extending his life via human sacrifice.
  5. The new members are thrust into dealing with the dark side of life that the founders of the society have been hoping to introduce them to.
  6. The new recruits defeat the wizard with help from the founders, but not before their friend is sacrificed.
data.title: jsp.architecture.thumbnail.fabula.title
data.subtitle: jsp.architecture.thumbnail.fabula.description

reason.text:
Caroline is a key figure in the creation of the Society of Esoteric Knowledge and Technology. She is one of Alexander's closets friends and colleague. She has tremendous sway over his discussions and is a valued advisor. 


She is concerned about bringing people into the fold because she knows it is basically a death sentence. She does not want to involve students unless they have already experienced the supernatural or if they are firm in their resolve to join the group. She believes that Berlioux is being reckless and should take steps to only select members who have had experiences in their past or who have come to the conclusion that they have nothing left to lose.

data.title: Claudia Templeton speaks with Berlioux about her doubts.

revisions.text:
The sharp sound of Professor Claudia Templeton's T-Straps on the polished marble tiles echoed loudly through the wide hallway of the Archaeology department. Her air of quiet superiority matched the expertly carved and polished wood paneled walls that stood as approving sentinels to countless students passing through on their way to academic enlightenment. She often reveled in her association with the Miskatonic University's long and honored contributions to the cultivation of young minds, forming budding youth into well prepared and knowledgable members of society.

Professor Templeton, smartly clad in a well pressed tweed blazer, plain white button down blouse and plaid skirt moved like a person of royal lineage striding through the halls of their kin. Her dark hair pulled tightly into a bun and horn rimed glasses gave her the appearance of a strict educator whose presence caused students to scurry out of the way as she past. Those who were able to meet her stoney gaze, however, would find her quite pretty and her smile, if she would offer one, spoke of a warm family centered upbringing.

The hall was vacant adding volume and resonance to the crack of her strides as she headed toward the last door on the right. Stoping for a moment to collect herself for the conversation she was about to be engaged in. She Paused with her hand on the worn brass knob of the wood and frosted glass door whose gold leafed lettering read, Alexander Berlioux Professor of Archeology and Egyptology. She remembered a time when coming to this office would seem a pleasure not a burden. Turning the knob she entered.
